content.description:
A variation on little chucky with a finish that rivals the start.

Begin as for little chucky. After reaching the jug rail, head back left using thin edges to join the finish of Chuckwalla.

SDS in small roof to the lower left of Flintlock Dyno. Start left hand on dish (has small crimp on it) and right hand on pinch and using the flake/scoops, work up and right into Flintlock finishing with the dyno.

Fun/flow movement, worth getting on if your in the area.

This short but fun dyno/reach problem is located just right of

Chuckawalla

(V1) on the far right side of the Chuckawalla Boulder.

This somewhat height-dependent problem starts with both hands matched on a large flat rail and involves a dyno or long reach to the incut jugs at the lip - kinda like going for the top of a fence. An easy descent exists off the northeast corner of the boulder.

A fun variation (V1) to this problem it to SDS with hands matched on the large flake/jug just to the left and work up to the rail and then work up small edges before grabbing the lip.

This problem is a link-up of

Flintlock Dyno

(V0) and

Chuckawalla

(V1) on the Chuckawalla Boulder.

Start on

Flintlock Dyno

with both hands matched on the large, flat edge and then reach up and left to a couple of edges (one good edge, the other not as good). Once established on these holds work way left using creative body positioning to the big edge midway on

Chuckawalla

and finish with the last moves of that problem.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree bouldering guide but is an obvious line with good movement on solid patina edges making this another problem worthy of inclusion to a circuit of the area.

Yabo sit start as you would for Little Chucky, but instead of moving out right, move left and straight up the boulder. Strenuous gaston move out to the left makes this more difficult if you're shorter.
content.location: Sit start as for Little Chucky.

content.description:
This short but sweet problem is located on the north face of the eponymous Chuckawalla Boulder which is located very near the infamous Iron Door Cave.

A series of balancy liebacks are the heart of this problem which offers fun and balancy movement throughout it's length. The movement on this problem is reminiscent of the

Fry Problem

near Cap Rock.

A sit start (V6) exists to this problem which powers left into the normal start via slopers, gastons and liebacks making this problem nearly twice as long.

Located on the left side of the Chuckawalla Boulder between

Big Lizard in my Backyard

(5.8) on the left and

Chuckawalla

(V1) on the right.

Start with hands wide on opposing sidepulls - left on the arete and right on a good edge - work your feet up and make a long reach to a good incut flake and the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree bouldering guide but is an obvious line with good movement on solid patina edges making this another problem worthy of inclusion to a circuit of the area.

This is the left most line on the Chuckawalla Boulder and is approximately 10' left of

Chuckawalla

(V1).

This easier problem (5.8) climbs a prominent right-curving arete with jugs from a standing start (the sit start is about V1 or so).

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree bouldering guide (it does show this problem in the photo for the boulder) but it's an obvious line with good movement on solid patina holds making this another problem worthy of inclusion to a circuit of the area.
